description: Kobus Magnolia (Magnolia kobus) is an amazing plant species for many reasons. A true winter bloomer, it is popular for its large showy flowers. The flowers are white with pink edges, and reach about seven inches in diameter, appearing in March and April. The plant is hardy and drought tolerant and its leaves are dark green and glossy. It is a deciduous tree, so adds spectacular color to a winter landscape with its foot-long buds and beautiful flowers. Its large, attractively shaped fruits are a pleasant addition to any garden. The Kobus Magnolia is a gorgeous addition to any garden and is sure to attract attention and admiration.
